info.title: Cosmos DB
info.description: Azure Cosmos DB Database Service Resource Provider REST API

get.description: Retrieves the properties of an existing Azure Cosmos DB database account.

200.description: The database account properties were retrieved successfully.

patch.description: Patches the properties of an existing Azure Cosmos DB database account.

parameters.name: updateParameters
parameters.description: The tags parameter to patch for the current database account.

200.description: The properties of the database account were patched successfully.

put.description: Creates or updates an Azure Cosmos DB database account.

parameters.name: createUpdateParameters
parameters.description: The parameters to provide for the current database account.

200.description: The database account create or update operation will complete asynchronously.

delete.description: Deletes an existing Azure Cosmos DB database account.

202.description: The database account delete operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: The specified account does not exist in the subscription.

post.description: Changes the failover priority for the Azure Cosmos DB database account. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists.

parameters.name: failoverParameters
parameters.description: The new failover policies for the database account.

202.description: Accepted. The failover policy change operation will complete asynchronously.

get.description: Lists all the Azure Cosmos DB database accounts available under the subscription.

200.description: The operation completed successfully.

get.description: Lists all the Azure Cosmos DB database accounts available under the given resource group.

200.description: The operation completed successfully.

post.description: Lists the access keys for the specified Azure Cosmos DB database account.

200.description: The operation completed successfully.

post.description: Lists the connection strings for the specified Azure Cosmos DB database account.

200.description: The operation completed successfully.

get.description: Lists the read-only access keys for the specified Azure Cosmos DB database account.

200.description: The operation completed successfully.

post.description: Regenerates an access key for the specified Azure Cosmos DB database account.

parameters.name: keyToRegenerate
parameters.description: The name of the key to regenerate.

200.description: OK

202.description: Accepted. The regenerate key operation will complete asynchronously.

head.description: Checks that the Azure Cosmos DB account name already exists. A valid account name may contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and the '-' character, and must be between 3 and 50 characters.

200.description: OK. The account name is valid but is already in use.

404.description: Not Found. The account name is available and valid.

get.description: Lists all of the available Cosmos DB Resource Provider operations.

200.description: OK

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given database account.

200.description: The metrics for the database account were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given database account and database.

200.description: The metrics for the database account were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given database account and collection.

200.description: The metrics for the database account were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given database account, collection and region.

200.description: The metrics for the database account were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given database account and region.

200.description: The metrics for the database account were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the usages (most recent data) for the given database account.

200.description: The usages for the database account were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the usages (most recent data) for the given database.

200.description: The usages for the database were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the usages (most recent storage data) for the given collection.

200.description: The usages for the collection were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves metric defintions for the given database.

200.description: The metric definitions for the database were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves metric defintions for the given collection.

200.description: The metric definitions for the collection were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves metric defintions for the given database account.

200.description: The metric definitions for the database account were retrieved successfully.

value.description: List of database account and their properties.

DatabaseAccountsListResult.description: The List operation response, that contains the database accounts and their properties.

FailoverPolicies.description: The list of new failover policies for the failover priority change.

FailoverPolicy.description: The failover policy for a given region of a database account.

id.description: The unique identifier of the region in which the database account replicates to. Example: <accountName>-<locationName>.

locationName.description: The name of the region in which the database account exists.

failoverPriority.description: The failover priority of the region. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists.

Location.description: A region in which the Azure Cosmos DB database account is deployed.

id.description: The unique identifier of the region within the database account. Example: <accountName>-<locationName>.

documentEndpoint.description: The connection endpoint for the specific region. Example: https://<accountName>-<locationName>.documents.azure.com:443/

failoverPriority.description: The failover priority of the region. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists.

id.description: The unique resource identifier of the database account.

name.description: The name of the database account.

location.description: The location of the resource group to which the resource belongs.

DatabaseAccount.description: An Azure Cosmos DB database account.

kind.description: Indicates the type of database account. This can only be set at database account creation.

ConsistencyPolicy.description: The consistency policy for the Cosmos DB database account.

defaultConsistencyLevel.description: The default consistency level and configuration settings of the Cosmos DB account.

maxStalenessPrefix.description: When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the number of stale requests tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 1 – 2,147,483,647. Required when defaultConsistencyPolicy is set to 'BoundedStaleness'.

maxIntervalInSeconds.description: When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the time amount of staleness (in seconds) tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 5 - 86400. Required when defaultConsistencyPolicy is set to 'BoundedStaleness'.

documentEndpoint.description: The connection endpoint for the Cosmos DB database account.

databaseAccountOfferType.description: The offer type for the Cosmos DB database account. Default value: Standard.

ipRangeFilter.description: Cosmos DB Firewall Support: This value specifies the set of IP addresses or IP address ranges in CIDR form to be included as the allowed list of client IPs for a given database account. IP addresses/ranges must be comma separated and must not contain any spaces.

enableAutomaticFailover.description: Enables automatic failover of the write region in the rare event that the region is unavailable due to an outage. Automatic failover will result in a new write region for the account and is chosen based on the failover priorities configured for the account.

consistencyPolicy.description: The consistency policy for the Cosmos DB database account.

writeLocations.description: An array that contains the write location for the Cosmos DB account.

readLocations.description: An array that contains of the read locations enabled for the Cosmos DB account.

failoverPolicies.description: An array that contains the regions ordered by their failover priorities.

DatabaseAccountCreateUpdateProperties.description: Properties to create and update Azure Cosmos DB database accounts.

consistencyPolicy.description: The consistency policy for the Cosmos DB account.

locations.description: An array that contains the georeplication locations enabled for the Cosmos DB account.

Tags.description: Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource. These tags can be used in viewing and grouping this resource (across resource groups). A maximum of 15 tags can be provided for a resource. Each tag must have a key no greater than 128 characters and value no greater than 256 characters.

ProvisioningState.description: The status of the Cosmos DB account at the time the operation was called. The status can be one of following. 'Creating' – the Cosmos DB account is being created. When an account is in Creating state, only properties that are specified as input for the Create Cosmos DB account operation are returned. 'Succeeded' – the Cosmos DB account is active for use. 'Updating' – the Cosmos DB account is being updated. 'Deleting' – the Cosmos DB account is being deleted. 'Failed' – the Cosmos DB account failed creation.

IPRangeFilter.description: Cosmos DB Firewall Support: This value specifies the set of IP addresses or IP address ranges in CIDR form to be included as the allowed list of client IPs for a given database account. IP addresses/ranges must be comma separated and must not contain any spaces.

apiVersionParameter.name: api-version
apiVersionParameter.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2015-04-08.

resourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
resourceGroupNameParameter.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

filterParameter.name: $filter
filterParameter.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of metrics to return. The parameters that can be filtered are name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names), startTime, endTime, and timeGrain. The supported operator is eq.

usageFilterParameter.name: $filter
usageFilterParameter.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of usages to return. The supported parameter is name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names).

regionParameter.name: region
regionParameter.description: Cosmos DB region, with spaces between words and each word capitalized.
